title: Problem with using languages on Facebook
content:
Problem with using languages on Facebook using Firefox It has not annoyed me before this time. I removed the previous version of Firefox and installed a new one. I notice since yesterday up to now, it doesn't support writing in two languages ( English + Arabic ) in one topic The English sentences or phrases I entered a midst Arabic text as ( examples ) become not arranged or distort, though I added the Arabic language to the browser.

Whether I choose English language only in the Firefox or I add Arabic ( to be two languages) , the problem is the same. (( cannot be fixed))  ?
creator: alrobaey51

creator: will34

title: Lavorando con Wikipedia non funziona più la funzione Visual Editor
content:
Buongiorno, da tempo lavoro come collaboratore di Wikipedia, traducendo o creando voci nuove. Dall'ultimo aggiornamento di Firefox non posso più utilizzare la funzione [Modifica] che significa modifica visuale, un visual editor estremamente efficiente per il nostro lavoro. Devo ricorrere alla vecchia [Modifica testuale] e non capisco il motivo, dato che con Chrome funziona tutto benissimo. Potete fare una prova entrando in Wikipedia, anche senza un account e tentare di utilizzare la Sandbox, la pagina delle prove. Sarebbe molto utile che sistemaste il problema, perché io preferisco Firefox, anche se Chrome è più veloce, ma io lo preferisco per una serie di ragioni. Grazie per l'attenzione.

per eventuali ulteriori delucidazioni potete scrivere a brunokito@gmail.com
creator: brunokito1

creator: nageshvemali303

title: SQLITE vs cookie storage
content:
I know that cookies are stored in a SQLITE database. I use a Linux distro and as per the documentation I viewed the cookie file at location '~/.mozilla/firefox/PROFILE_FOLDER/cookies.sqlite' and I can view all the contents as expected.'

However, these two things are bugging me if someone can please help me:

(i) SQLITE isn't a server connected database (it just offers minimal functionality) and since cookies are something accessed by server side from http headers with every request how does that work out?

(ii) Session storage key value pairs are stored in '~/.mozilla/firefox/PROFILE_FOLDER/webappsstore.sqlite' however, when I create session storage key value pairs and without closing the tab if I try viewing the session key; I can't find the key value pairs. I tried with Local storage and it works however with session storage it does not show me the key value pair in database.
creator: pankajgenesr4444

title: Looking for a good place to build a free website + auto email service
content:
Hello

Hope you are good + thank you for all you do ...

We have built a website on MAILCHIMP + used MAILCHIMP for automailing ...

We are a community group with no money - so were glad to have the free service.

We were not able to use MAILCHIMP for automail this week ...

Can anyone recommend an ethical - preferably free website + autoemailer ...

We find MOZILLA to be a great product that you can trust ...

Hope we have a good week

In love + solidarity

Wendy

From Paternalism to Human rights

YOUTUBE - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgiAtYMh6O_Vv13Lf7v7wNg

Friendship group website - https://friendship-group-affiliated-to-hvn.mailchimpsites.com/

title: When video player is closed it creates a window that continues to play video
content: When visiting a website and launching a video it plays fine. When I decide that I have watched enough and close the video window it moves to the side and continues to play. I have closed the video because I don't want to see or hear it any longer. This very annoying and I can't figure out how to prevent this from happening. Does anyone know how to disable this annoying behaviour? Firefox 94.0.1 64 bit Windows 10 Pro
creator: kobostage
